body_html: @darrengarvey I believe that this is because MonitoredTrainingSession isn't a Session, it's something that wraps a Session, so does not implement the interface that as_default() would require. If it was a subclass of Session, this would be possible, but I think by design it is not. :(
body_text: @darrengarvey I believe that this is because MonitoredTrainingSession isn't a Session, it's something that wraps a Session, so does not implement the interface that as_default() would require.  If it was a subclass of Session, this would be possible, but I think by design it is not.  :(
body: @darrengarvey I believe that this is because MonitoredTrainingSession isn't a Session, it's something that wraps a Session, so does not implement the interface that as_default() would require.  If it was a subclass of Session, this would be possible, but I think by design it is not.  :(
